alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 6:02AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern St. Louis and northwestern Lake Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 601 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tower, to 6 miles south of Robinson, to near Babbitt, to 10 miles west of Whyte, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Robinson around 610 AM CDT. Ely, Burntside Lake and White Iron Lake around 615 AM CDT. Winton, Fall Lake, Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness Near Trout Lake and Birch Lake around 620 AM CDT. Basswood Lake around 630 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Ensign Lake, Bald Eagle Lake, Seven Beaver Lake, Gabbro Lake, Ojibway Lake, Farm Lake, Soudan, Bear Island Lake, Bear Head Lake and Disappointment Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake
